title: Funerary inscription for Caecinia Sozusa
support: Part of a thick grey marble plaque, partially intact on upper, left and lower edges, broken on the right, with damage to upper and lower left corners and along the top edge. Finished smooth on the rear, the edges roughtly finished.

layout.p: Four lines of Latin letters, probably centred on the stone, first line centred, lines 2-4 maintaining a consistent left margin.

handNote.lettering: V-cut letters with serifs and use of lightly incised small hederae; M slightly extended upper strokes, A with slping cross bar, E and L with downward sloping bars.

provenanceFound._: Found in the ruins of the castle of Termini, in 1883

provenanceObserved._: Prag 2022-07-13, storeroom of the Museo Civico, Termini.

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2022-07-13.

museum.name: Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
museum.description: A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions

location.address: Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)
